title: How do people feel about champ shards being in hextech chests?
body: Honestly I feel like champion capsules you get from leveling up should be the place where you get the shards you need for new champions. The missions that you get as a new player is also a decent way of getting new champions. If the capsules are the only source of BE, then why not just buff them a tiny bit so new players have the chance to get new champions and BE? I always get disappointed when I work super hard to grind out missions for key fragments, make a key, unlock a chest, and just get an utter garbage champion shard for someone I already have tier 7 on, or already own as a champion. I would literally take anything else I got out of the hextech chest. It just feels awful when you are expecting, at the very least, a ward skin or emote.

replies.body: I feel mildly annoyed, especially since I have 33k BE already.

It sucks to wait a week to open a chest just to get a champion shard. I own every champion already and just have a bunch of shard that i'm to lazy to dust. It really is annoying. Especially because you can spend money on chests and keys and still get champion shards in them.

Or, you know, let us exchange BE for something and this problem is not a problem anymore xD
good things to spend be on, without much profit lost to riot and ofc no gameplay advantage 
* Single-Use Finishers
* Single-use cosmetics (could be tower, skin, poro pet whatever)
* Aram/Arurf rerolls (with a max per game ofc)
* XP-boosts (can be single use or for set amount of time)
* masterwork chests (for upwards of 10k-20K BE or something)
hexichest belong to premium only things like wards/skins/gemstones/emotes (things that cost RP) personally. anything else is a abomination.
